I'm wondering whether to install alioth's debian-amd64 repo or ubuntu
see, I'm done with this xfree86.  I don't want it.
to what, the kernel building process? :)

use fakeroot instead of running it as root or as a user
so I'd do:  make-kpkg fakeroot --initrd vmlinuz-2.6.11.5
I'm fairly certain you want fakeroot make-kpkg --initrd             make-kpkg --rootcmd fakeroot kernel_image
how does make-kpkg know where the System.map file is for the corresponding kernel_image ?
they're named matching the respective uname -r
hmm, I dunno what the uname -r name of this fresh bzImage is.. how can I find out?

but you don't pass that to make-kpkg

when you build a kernel, it uses that one

if you want to run mkinitrd manually, then don't use make-kpkg
I have no idea how to do this then.  All I want to do is to add a kernel image to grub, and I understand that I need an initrd.img...
yes, my linux is already compiled.
you don't necessarily need an initrd if you compiled the root fs in as 'y'
grub chokes on startup and thinks that it can't open /dev/md2 because it cannot read an ext2 superblock or something

does the default ubuntu image work?

read, and it looks like debian/rules is severely broken

the problem is that the conditional test for wacom.o fails to copy over the _other_ compiled modules, and for good reason, since the hid option is disabled by default in debian rules, so it won't copy over non-compiled modules
the easiest way to work around it presently is to copy over all the other modules
that's just it, I can't find them anywhere
that's because they're not copied over in debian/rules, like I said above
I meant, I can't find them in the src/
and then build the new kernel completely
no, I meant fixing debian/rules.  Sec, I'll try to generate one for you.

or can you point me to a url?
the order is that you have to load it before HID
hmm, where did I find this.. one second.

we'll mail them your updated debian/rules?
